title: Past Simple or Past Perfect - 3
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use B1past simpleB2 or B1past perfectB2.

sentence: my present wife only for a year when I
remarks: Corr: had known. It's past perfect because we speak about a period of time (for a year) before a past moment.
Corr: proposed. It's past simple because it didn't happen before anything.

sentence: all the sandwiches by the time I
remarks: Corr: had eaten. It's past perfect because this action had happened earlier than the action in the 'by the time' part.
Corr: arrived. It's past simple because it's in the 'by the time' part of the sentence. It's a time adverb.

sentence: asleep at the meeting because I
remarks: Corr: fell. It's past simple because it happened later than the action in the next clause.
Corr: hadn't drunk. It's past perfect because it had happened before the action in the previous clause.
Corr: arrived. It's past simple because this is where the story starts.
Corr: switched. It's past simple because it happend after the previous action.
Corr: saw. It's past simple because it happened after the previous action.
Corr: had tampered. It's past perfect because it had happened before all the previous actions.
Corr: was. It's past simple because the story starts here, it didn't happen before anything.
Corr: had lost. It's past perfect because it had happened earlier, that is, before the speaker was sorry.
Corr: had grown. It's past perfect because it had happened before the speaker was sorry.

sentence: to put my umbrella in my bag.
remarks: Corr: started. It's past simple because the story starts here.
Corr: became. It's past simple because it happened after the previous action.
Corr: got. It's past simple because it happened after the previous action.
Corr: had forgotten. It's past perfect because it had happened before all the actions in the previous clauses.

sentence: very happy to see that my wife
remarks: Corr: arrived. It's past simple because the story starts here.
Corr: was. It's past simple because happened after the previous action.
Corr: had cooked. It's past perfect because it had happened before the previous action.
Corr: had laid. It's past perfect because this action had started before the past simply signifying the beginning of the story.

sentence: any of my work, so I
remarks: Corr: got. It's past simple because the story starts here.
Corr: started. It's past simple because this action happened after the previous action.
Corr: hadn't done. It's past perfect because this action had happened before the speaker 'got back' from holidays.
Corr: was. It's past simple because ths action happened after the previous actions.
